blog = jekyll & nitrous

12 jan 2014

i am not a blogger .. but .. i have made the decision to become a software developer .. and .. it has come to my attention that the aforementioned blog .. alot .. soooo .. when in rome ..

i have reviewed alot and tried a few blogging solutions. most, make posting about and with code snippets a chore. i came across this blog post suggests a “hacker friendly” solution using Jekyll and Nitrous.IO. i will attempt to chronicle my experiences regarding.

why Jekyll and Nitrous.IO? one word: GitHub. i have spent the better part of the last 6 months using GH for version control. plus, as Juri points out, using this combo “reflects the kind of blogging experience you want as a dev, with Markdown support, full version control and amazing hosting ..”.

Configure GitHub GHPages ..

Configuring Jekyll on Nitrous http://help.nitrous.io/ide-shortcuts/

Install Jekyll http://jekyllrb.com/ http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/basics

Start Blogging Now you can open the corresponding blog markdown file in the web IDE and start writing your blog post. You can even directly run Jekyll on Nitrous and preview the resulting posts in the browser while writing it.
